question: What should I do before contacting support?
answer: Before writing to support, consider checking the system status page and the Known issues page to see if the problem you're experiencing has already been reported.

question: Why is it important for my email address to be registered with my account when contacting support?
answer: Please ensure that the email address from which you are writing is registered in your account. This way, our ticketing system will be able to recognize you automatically.

question: How can I get faster assistance from the support staff?
answer: A well written question (or a problem description) will likely result in a faster and more accurate assistance from our staff.

question: What kind of email subject lines should I avoid for support requests?
answer: An email titled 'Something is wrong' or 'Nothing works' will take a long time to resolve, because we will have to ask you to provide missing information.

question: What information should I include in the subject line of my support email?
answer: In the subject line of the email, include the system/cluster name and a few words of what may be wrong. For example, 'Job 123456 fails to run on the Cedar cluster'.

question: Should I use an old email thread for a new support topic?
answer: Please do not request help on a different topic as a follow-up to an old email thread. Instead, start a brand new one to avoid re-opening an old ticket.

question: Which email address should I use for questions about my account?
Where should I send questions regarding account renewals?
answer: Questions about account renewals should be sent to `renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca`.

question: What is the email address for questions about Globus file transfer services?
answer: For questions about Globus file transfer services, email `globus@tech.alliancecan.ca`.

question: Who should I contact for questions about Cloud resources?
answer: Questions about using Cloud resources should be sent to `cloud@tech.alliancecan.ca`.

question: Which email address is for inquiries about the Resource Allocation Competition (RAC)?
answer: For questions about the Resource Allocation Competition (RAC), email `allocations@tech.alliancecan.ca`.

question: What is the general support email address for any other question or issue?
answer: For any other question or issue, email `support@tech.alliancecan.ca`.

question: What information is required in a support request to help staff better?
answer: To help us help you better, please include the Cluster name, Job ID, Job submission script, File or files which contain the error message(s), Commands that you were executing, Software (name and version) you were trying to use, and When did the problem happen?

question: How should I provide my job submission script in a support request?
answer: You can either give the full path of the script on the cluster; copy and paste the script; or attach the script file.

question: What are the acceptable ways to provide error message files in a support request?
answer: You can give the full path of the file(s); copy and paste the file(s); or attach the error message(s) file(s).

question: Should I send screenshots in my support request?
answer: Avoid sending screenshots or other large image attachments except when necessary - the plain text of your commands, job script etc. is usually more helpful.

question: Do I need to give explicit permission for staff to access my files or account?
answer: If you want us to access, copy or edit your files, or inspect your account and possibly make changes there, say so explicitly in your email, unless you have already granted us permission via the CCDB interface to access your files.
